meanings.sent1: She found a niblet of paper on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The niblet of glass sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel carried the niblet of acorn up the tree.
meanings.sent4: His heart shattered into a niblet of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The detective discovered a crucial niblet of evidence.

meanings.definition: A small, tender kernel of corn
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the sweet niblet of corn on the cob.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a niblet of corn to the soup for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: The niblet of corn popped in the microwave with a loud bang.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with golden niblets of corn ready for harvest.
meanings.sent5: The farmer proudly displayed his fresh niblets of corn at the market.
